name: places/ChIJbZSkF-NYwokRHuJ_C7oN90k
formattedAddress: 201 E 65th St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 201 E 65th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text:
While I was impressed by the Doctor’s bedside manners, I was prescribed a sleep study. The device kept falling off and I complained twice to the office asking for what I could do. They said they would get back to me. I don’t hear back for 5 weeks after which I get a message from the doctor saying they’ve processed my sleep study along with my diagnosis.

How do you process a sleep study when it wasn’t even on my body? I called the clinic asking for an explanation last week, and I am yet to hear back

Edit: the practice called me after reading this review. They got into the details of what went wrong and apologized for what happened. They won my trust by their transparency. I would give them a chance again.

originalText.text: Dr Pate has been my Primary Care Physician for a few years now.  She is nothing but compassionate, patient, and extremely knowledgeable.  I have always felt extremely comfortable seeing her as well as asking her any questions and concerns I have had.  Her staff at the office has always been swift and efficient in trying to accommodate me as well.

text.text: Dr Pate has been my Primary Care Physician for a few years now.  She is nothing but compassionate, patient, and extremely knowledgeable.  I have always felt extremely comfortable seeing her as well as asking her any questions and concerns I have had.  Her staff at the office has always been swift and efficient in trying to accommodate me as well.

originalText.text: Dr Pate and Dr. Kini are the best doctors I’ve ever had. I’ve sent many friends to them and continue to even though I left NYC three years ago. I’ve since lived in Minneapolis, Chicago area, and now DC area, and I have yet to find doctors that even come close. Dr Pate and her partner Dr Kini are extremely caring and thorough. They take their time to listen and actually care about I getting to know you. They are absolutely wonderful and I wish I could still be their patient. If you want a doctor who will figure out what’s wrong with you, and truly look into things, then these are your gals!

originalText.text:
I was referred to Dr. Pate by another doctor in the city.  I so wish I had read through these reviews first!  They are spot on and very much reflect the experience I had as well when I attempted to have a physical with Dr. Pate a few weeks ago.  She seems like a warm and well intentioned person, but the delivery of services is just awful.  First, I was very clear in my booking that I wanted to see her and not her nurse or assistant, as I have some background medical issues I wanted to talk to her about.  Despite confirming my appointment repeatedly and being kept waiting a good while, my visit was essentially only with her assistant — that made me very frustrated and upset.  With no disrespect to the assistant, if I wanted to see you, I’d book with you.  The assistant was also very determined to push extensive cardiology screening despite my telling her that I had my own cardiologist, had just had an extensive cardiology workup elsewhere, and that I would follow up with my own specialist if needed.  She bristled at this, and said I had no choice but to “at least” have an ekg — which was done, after another lengthy wait, by a nurse who didn’t seem confident in how to do the procedure?  I was also told the result was abnormal — very alarmist and I have reason to think that wasn’t actually true — i asked to get a copy of their ekg readout and noone would get back to me, so hard to know...  The entire vibe with the assistant was tense and unpleasant — perhaps compounded by the fact that she wasn’t the person I booked the appointment to see?  Dr. Pate came in after I had been in the office for about an hour and a half — I was insanely hungry and thirsty and frustrated at that point — she too seemed to want to talk about cardiology issues rather than just telling me to follow up with my own cardiologist.  There was no time to ask her about all the issues I DID come to see her about, and when I asked she said, “why don’t you make an appointment to come see me?”  I was speechless, I was so angry.  Why did she think I was there???

I requested a vaccination and explained to the assistant why it was a good idea for me to have it — forgot to tell her about checking preservatives so I was given one with preservative in it and had a bad reaction the next day — I’ll take responsibility for that since I guess I was supposed to be managing that?

I had some high bloodtest results that were posted on line within a few days — noone from the office ever called me.  They had told me the procedure is to book and pay for ANOTHER appointment to come in and go over results if you want to see the doctor, and that THEN I would get to see her and not her assistant.  I declined to have that experience again.  Booked with my own specialists to follow up.  I will NEVER go back - just awful from start to finish, and I haven’t even received the bill yet.

originalText.text:
I went to Medical Offices of Manhattan and visited Dr. Kapoor who was great, I was due for a physical and decided to visit Dr. Pate for her availability.

First...I received my lab test through Lab Finder quickly and still didn't hear from her for over 2 days!! Their front office claimed that she only reviews hard copies and they don't review electronic lab tests. Very interesting - didn't have that problem with Dr. Kappor. Then it was only after I called profusely did she immediately call me back.

Typically, the doctor will call you and discuss results. She told me I was absolutely fine, but because of my high cholesterol, she suggested I visit a cardiologist, and then rushed me off the phone.

After visiting the cardiologist, I realized there was absolutely NO need for me to go. The cardiologist himself was confused why I was there, and i was charged for so many UNNECESSARY FOLLOW UP TESTS and then he gave me another referral to another doctor for cholesterol medication. When in reality, Dr. Pate could have prescribed me medication before even referring to a cardiologist, and the cardiologist clearly didn't care either.

AVOID MEDICAL OFFICES OF MANHATTAN AT ALL COSTS. They claim to care about customer care but in fact, they're just looking for ways to make money and take as much from both YOU and YOUR INSURANCE COMPANY.
